stories.title: Mathematically Correct Breakfast How to Slice a Bagel into Two Linked Halves
One doesn't have to be a genius to do mathematics

stories.text:
I am not interested in bypassing paywalls. I just want to browse the web as if all those paywall sites do not even exist.

For example, I'd be happy if any link to a paywall site is replaced by a text indicating this is filtered. I don't want to see any paywall site results in Google search, or links in Google news... etc.

Appreciate any pointers.
stories.title: Ask HN: How can I filter out paywalls from my internet?
Jupyter.org now runs its notebooks on WebAssembly
How to tell if site is DDoS attacked vs. it's geoblocking
Experts urge EU not to force insecure certificates in web browsers

stories.text:
The BBC is relaunching the News Service for Ukraine/Russia. https://tech.slashdot.org/story/22/03/04/1357239/bbc-resurrects-wwii-era-shortwave-broadcasts-as-russia-blocks-news-of-ukraine-invasion?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed

Is this streamable or is there a recorded archive where I can listen to it later?
stories.title: Stream BBC News Service about Ukraine
Skater loses funding over controversial outfit choice before Olympics
Shell to put profits from Russian oil trade into Ukraine aid fund
